radiographic_examinations.findings: The imaged lung bases are clear. The liver enhances normally without concerning focal liver lesion. No intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilation. The gallbladder contains a gallstone without evidence for acute cholecystitis. The pancreas enhances normally. The spleen and splenule appear normal. Adrenals are normal bilaterally. The kidneys enhance symmetrically. The abdominal aorta is normal in course and caliber. No adenopathy, free air or free fluid. The stomach and duodenum appear normal. Small bowel loops demonstrate no signs of ileus or obstruction. The appendix appears hyperemic and mildly dilated to 9 mm without periappendiceal fat stranding. The cecum appears normal. The colon is unremarkable containing only a mild fecal load. Diverticulosis is seen without evidence of diverticulitis. No pelvic sidewall or inguinal adenopathy. The urinary bladder is decompressed. The prostate is unremarkable. A small periumbilical hernia is noted containing fat.
